description.narrative: UNICEF's support to Government on COVID-19 RCCE intervention include capacity building and system strengthening including establishing strategic partnership at various levels including collaboration with non-traditional partners viz. religious leaders, scout's association and sister UN agencies for meaningful public engagement. An estimated 488,000 people were reached with lifesaving messages on COVID-19 prevention and access to services including access to services on COVID-19 shadow issues through engagement and capacity building of about 18,000 community communicators and volunteers | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of people who participate in COVID-19 engagement actions [COVIDSitRep]
Number of people reached on COVID-19 through messaging on prevention and access to services [COVIDSitRep]

Capacity development strategy under implementation to strengthen and institutionalize C4D skills of government, implementing partners staff at national level and subnational level meets quality standards
Budgeting for C4D Strategies meets quality standards
Generation and use of social, behavioural and communication data and evidence meets quality standards for informing and monitoring C4D strategies in Country Programme priorities
Country programme meets organizational standards on results-based management
